publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2789 Alison McInnes: Inverurie Paper Mill—That the Parliament notes with concern the uncertainty surrounding the future of Inverurie Paper Mill following the announcement by its owner, International Paper, that it is consulting stakeholders about its future; further notes that the mill employs approximately 370 people, mostly in skilled positions, at a prime business location in Aberdeenshire, and calls on International Paper to ensure that the consultation is a genuinely inclusive process with a view to securing the best outcome for employees. Supported by: Nanette Milne*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Jamie Stone*, Jim Hume*, John Park*, Bill Kidd*, Mike Pringle*, Ken Macintosh*, Robert Brown*, Robin Harper*, Jim Tolson*, Ross Finnie*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-2789 Inverurie Paper Mill (lodged on 29 October 2008) Liam McArthur*, Mike Rumbles*

S3M-2789 Alison McInnes: Inverurie Paper Mill—That the Parliament notes with concern the uncertainty surrounding the future of Inverurie Paper Mill following the announcement by its owner, International Paper, that it is consulting stakeholders about its future; further notes that the mill employs approximately 370 people, mostly in skilled positions, at a prime business location in Aberdeenshire, and calls on International Paper to ensure that the consultation is a genuinely inclusive process with a view to securing the best outcome for employees. Supported by: Nanette Milne, Hugh O’Donnell, Roseanna Cunningham, Jamie Stone, Jim Hume, John Park, Bill Kidd, Mike Pringle, Ken Macintosh, Robert Brown, Robin Harper, Jim Tolson, Ross Finnie, Gil Paterson, Liam McArthur, Mike Rumbles, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-2789 Inverurie Paper Mill (lodged on 29 October 2008) Nicol Stephen*
S3M-2789 Inverurie Paper Mill (lodged on 29 October 2008) Brian Adam*
S3M-2789 Inverurie Paper Mill (lodged on 29 October 2008) Cathy Peattie*
S3M-2789 Inverurie Paper Mill (lodged on 29 October 2008) Keith Brown*
